$interpreted: Theodore: I thought you were trustworthy enough to keep your promises, Eidatyr. Didn't you promise Rune that you'd never return to the north?
Eidatyr: Tsk, I didn't expect to come back, either...
Theodore: I should have expected as much from a pirate.
Theodore: Come now, Rune. It's not too late to prove your loyalty.
Rune: I...
Sophie: How long are you going to keep on deceiving him for? It was you who hid my letters from him, wasn't it?!
Rune: Master... Sophie says, you have letters? True?
Theodore: ......
Theodore: ...I see. Your circus have come to claim you.
Rune: Yes. They didn't, abandon Rune.
Theodore: Indeed. It's I who'll be abandoning you.
Theodore: Arrest them. I want the twins alive. Do as you will with the rest.
Rune: But...
Eidatyr: Theodore! You'll get what's coming to you!
Ru-yi: Waaah, that looked painful!
Hutchinson: She must have been holding onto that for a long while...
Hanbei: Wait, what are you up to now?
Eidatyr: Isn't it obvious? I'm going to kill him.
Rune: ...Why?
Eidatyr: Look at how things stand now. Don't you get it? He's a calamity waiting to happen. We don't need the trouble.
Rune: But...
Rune: Theodore, not like Eidatyr. Keeps word. He never, left Valdrir, to die.
Eidatyr: ...You... You know it was never as simple as that...
Sophie: But... I don't think killing him is the right thing to do. He's one of the Kingdom of the Sun's royal family, isn't he?
Eidatyr: Tsk... You damn southern softies... Tell me then, what are we supposed to do with him?
Sophie: Hmm, let me think...
Valdrir: ......
Valdrir: My seeds... Grow!
Eidatyr: Valdrir?!
Valdrir: Don't follow, Eida.
Sophie: Rune!
Eidatyr: Don't. It's certain death if you jump.
Sophie: But Rune and Valdrir...
Eidatyr: They'll be fine... for the moment.
Eidatyr: The northern lands are home to fiery volcanoes and frozen glaciers. Every stratum is filled with crevasses, potholes, and subglacial lakes. It's a labyrinth.
Eidatyr: Some passages interlock and intersect, some lead to dead ends... Even I'd get lost inside, nevermind you lot.
Eidatyr: A subglacial lake...
Ru-yi: The surface is all covered in ice... It all looks like one expanse...
Eidatyr: Yup, you can't see it. That's why Val told us not to follow. It's just too dangerous.
Hutchinson: But the Saga clan mother—
Eidatyr: ...She knows the passageways.
Eidatyr: Val's a good girl. She believes in the clan's ancient wisdom and discipline. Including—the oral tradition that maps out the crevasses and lakes.
Eidatyr: ...Only she could pull off something so stupid.
Sophie: So what are we gonna do now?
Eidatyr: ...Stick with me. We'll be taking the long way around, but at least I know where that idiot's headed.

Model.Text: I thought you were trustworthy enough to keep your promises, Eidatyr. Didn't you promise Rune that you'd never return to the north?
Tsk, I didn't expect to come back, either...
I should have expected as much from a pirate.
Come now, Rune. It's not too late to prove your loyalty.
How long are you going to keep on deceiving him for? It was you who hid my letters from him, wasn't it?!
Master... Sophie says, you have letters? True?
...I see. Your circus have come to claim you.
Yes. They didn't, abandon Rune.
Indeed. It's I who'll be abandoning you.
Arrest them. I want the twins alive. Do as you will with the rest.
But...
Theodore! You'll get what's coming to you!
Waaah, that looked painful!
She must have been holding onto that for a long while...
Wait, what are you up to now?
Isn't it obvious? I'm going to kill him.
...Why?
Look at how things stand now. Don't you get it? He's a calamity waiting to happen. We don't need the trouble.
But...
Theodore, not like Eidatyr. Keeps word. He never, left Valdrir, to die.
...You... You know it was never as simple as that...
But... I don't think killing him is the right thing to do. He's one of the Kingdom of the Sun's royal family, isn't he?
Tsk... You damn southern softies... Tell me then, what are we supposed to do with him?
Hmm, let me think...
My seeds... Grow!
Valdrir?!
Don't follow, Eida.
Rune!
Don't. It's certain death if you jump.
But Rune and Valdrir...
They'll be fine... for the moment.
The northern lands are home to fiery volcanoes and frozen glaciers. Every stratum is filled with crevasses, potholes, and subglacial lakes. It's a labyrinth.
Some passages interlock and intersect, some lead to dead ends... Even I'd get lost inside, nevermind you lot.
A subglacial lake...
The surface is all covered in ice... It all looks like one expanse...
Yup, you can't see it. That's why Val told us not to follow. It's just too dangerous.
But the Saga clan mother—
...She knows the passageways.
Val's a good girl. She believes in the clan's ancient wisdom and discipline. Including—the oral tradition that maps out the crevasses and lakes.
...Only she could pull off something so stupid.
So what are we gonna do now?
...Stick with me. We'll be taking the long way around, but at least I know where that idiot's headed.
